title: Issue 1 - August 1, 2011
header: You are busy churning out code or managing the developers. You care about Perl but don't have time to go through tens and hundreds of articles and blog posts every day. You want to keep an eye on the development of Perl without drawning in a sea of blog posts. You need someone to point out the most important news and articles in the Perl World.
Let me try to be your guide.

entries.text: Olaf Alders provided his weekly report that was full of new items.
entries.title: Huge progress in the development of MetaCPAN

entries.text: This edition of the quarterly release marks the end of era. The next release will be already using the 'New Object Model'
entries.title: Rakudo Star 2011.07 released with 10%-30% improvement in compile and execution speed

entries.text: A 10 page white paper explaining what is the cloud and what are the benefits (e.g. pay as you go,  on demand infrastructure, no upfront investment) It compares Amazon EC2 and Rackspace the leaders in providing infrastructure and then introduces Cloud Foundry. Then I had to fill a form to read about Stackato.
entries.title: Whitepaper from ActiveState: Perl and Python in the Cloud

entries.text: Tom Eliaz reports on creating a DMG package Padre for Leopard, Snow Leopard, and Lion.
entries.title: Padre on OSX
